question.text: Which of the following describes an Arrhenius acid?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, an Arrhenius acid is defined as a species that is an H + producer . Therefore, the answer is B .

question.text: Which of the following species in the equation below represents a Bronsted-Lowry base? H 2 O + NH 3 ⇌ OH - + NH 4

options.label: A.
options.text: H 2 O since it is an electron donor

options.label: B.
options.text: OH - since it is a proton donor

options.label: C.
options.text: H 2 O since it is a proton donor

options.label: D.
options.text: NH 3 since it is a proton acceptor

options.label: E.
options.text: NH 4 + since it is an electron acceptor

correct_answer_text: NH 3 since it is a proton acceptor

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case ( H 2 O + NH 3 ⇌ OH - + NH 4 + ), we can see that a proton (H + ) was transferred from H 2 O to NH 3 , resulting in the production of OH - and NH 4 + . NH 3 represents a Bronsted-Lowry base since it is a proton acceptor (Option D). Therefore, the answer is D.

question.text: Which of the following most accurately describes a Lewis base?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, a Lewis base is a species that acts as an electron pair donor. Therefore, the answer is C .

question.text: Which of the following species produces H + ions in solution?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, a species that produces H + ions in solution in an Arrhenius acid . Therefore, the answer is E .

question.text: Which of the following species accepts an H + ion from another species in solution?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, a species that accepts an H + ion from another species in a Bronsted-Lowry base. Therefore, the answer is C .

question.text: Identify the acid/base behavior of each species in the reaction below. HF ( aq ) + H 2 O ( l) ⇌ H 3 O + ( aq ) + F - ( aq )

options.label: A.
options.text: HF ( aq ) is an acid, H 2 O ( l) ) is a base, H 3 O + ( aq ) is an acid, F - ( aq ) is a base

options.label: B.
options.text: HF ( aq ) is an acid, H 2 O ( l) is a base, H 3 O + ( aq ) is a base, F - ( aq ) is an acid

options.label: C.
options.text: HF ( aq ) is a base, H 2 O ( l) is a base, H 3 O + ( aq ) is an acid, F - ( aq ) is a base

options.label: D.
options.text: HF ( aq ) is a base, H 2 O ( l) ) is an acid, H 3 O + ( aq ) is an acid, F - ( aq ) is a base

options.label: E.
options.text: HF ( aq ) is a base, H 2 O ( l) is an acid, H 3 O + ( aq ) is a base, F - ( aq ) is an acid

correct_answer_text: HF ( aq ) is an acid, H 2 O ( l) ) is a base, H 3 O + ( aq ) is an acid, F - ( aq ) is a base

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving a cids and bases , we will need to review what acids and bases are. In this case, combining the Arrhenius, Bronsted-Lowry, and Lewis definitions of acids and bases, we know that: In the reaction above, we can see that: Altogether, we can see that HF (aq) is an acid, H 2 O ( l ) is a base, H 3 O + (aq) is an acid, F - (aq) is a base (Option A). Therefore, the answer is A .

question.text: Which of the following can act as an Arrhenius base?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, we must remember that an Arrhenius base produces OH - ions, and the only option that contains and releases OH - ions in solution is Mg(OH) 2 . Option A. NaCl Incorrect. An Arrhenius base needs to be able to produce OH - ions in solution. NaCl does not contain any OH - ions, therefore it cannot act as an Arrhenius base. Option B. NH 3 Incorrect. An Arrhenius base needs to be able to produce OH - ions in solution. NH 3 does not contain any OH - ions, therefore it cannot act as an Arrhenius base. It can, however, act as a Lewis base by donating a pair of electrons. Option C. CaCO 3 Incorrect. An Arrhenius base needs to be able to produce OH - ions in solution. CaCO 3 does not contain any OH - ions, therefore it cannot act as an Arrhenius base. Option D. Mg(OH) 2 Correct. An Arrhenius base needs to be able to produce OH - ions in solution. Mg(OH) 2 contains OH - ions that can dissociate into OH - in water, therefore it can act as an Arrhenius base. Option E. HNO 3 Incorrect. An Arrhenius base needs to be able to produce OH - ions in solution. HNO 3 does not contain any OH - ions, therefore it cannot act as an Arrhenius base. It can, however, act as an Arrhenius acid by producing H + ions in solution, or act as a Bronsted-Lowry acid by donating an H + ion to another species. Therefore, the answer is D .

question.text: Identify the correct Lewis species with its acid/base behavior in the reaction below: NH 3( aq ) + H 2 O ( l) ⇌ NH 4 + ( aq ) + OH - ( aq )

options.label: A.
options.text: NH 3( aq ) acts as a Lewis acid

options.label: B.
options.text: NH 4 + ( aq ) acts as a Lewis base

options.label: C.
options.text: NH 3( aq ) acts as a Lewis base

options.label: D.
options.text: OH - ( aq ) acts as a Lewis acid

options.label: E.
options.text: H 2 O ( l) acts as a Lewis base

correct_answer_text: NH 3( aq ) acts as a Lewis base

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In the reaction (NH 3(aq) + H 2 O ( l ) ⇌ NH 4 + (aq) + OH - (aq) ), we can see that NH 3 donates a pair of electrons (to form a new N-H bond), and therefore acts as a Lewis base: Option A. NH 3(aq) acts as a Lewis acid Incorrect. NH 3 donates a pair of electrons when it forms a bond with H + to make NH 4 + . Therefore, it acts as a Lewis base. Option B. NH4+(aq) acts as a Lewis base Incorrect. NH 4 + accepts a pair of electrons when H + is produced and combined with OH - , resulting in the production of a lone pair. Therefore, it acts as a Lewis acid. Option C. NH 3(aq) acts as a Lewis base Correct. NH 3 donates a pair of electrons when it forms a bond with H + to make NH 4 + . Therefore, it acts as a Lewis base. Option D. OH - (aq) acts as a Lewis acid Incorrect. OH - donates a pair of electrons to form a bond with H + to produce H 2 O. Therefore, it acts as a Lewis base. Option E. H 2 O (l) acts as a Lewis base Incorrect. H 2 O accepts a pair of electrons when H + produced and combined with NH 3 , resulting in the production of a lone pair. Therefore, it acts as a Lewis acid. Therefore, the answer is C .

question.text: In which of the following reactions does H 2 O ( l) act as an acid?

options.label: A.
options.text: 2 Na ( aq ) + 2 H 2 O ( l) ⇌ H 2( g ) + 2 NaOH ( aq )

options.label: B.
options.text: NO 2 - (aq) + H 2 O ( l) ⇌ HNO 2( aq ) + OH - ( aq )

options.label: D.
options.text: CH 3 COOH ( aq ) + H 2 O ( l) ⇌ H 3 O + (aq) + CH 3 COO - ( aq )

options.label: E.
options.text: H 2 O ( l) + H 3 PO 4( aq ) ⇌ H 3 O + ( aq ) + H 2 PO 4 - ( aq )

correct_answer_text: NO 2 - (aq) + H 2 O ( l) ⇌ HNO 2( aq ) + OH - ( aq )

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving acids and bases, we will need to review what acids and bases are. In this case, combining the Arrhenius, Bronsted-Lowry, and Lewis definitions of acids and bases, we know that: In this case, in the reaction (NO2 - (aq) + H 2 O ( l ) ⇌ HNO 2(aq) + OH - (aq) ), we can see that the H 2 O has donated an H + ion to NO 2 - , resulting in the production of HNO 2 . Therefore H 2 O is acting as an acid in this reaction. Option A. 2 Na (aq) + 2 H 2 O (l) ⇌ H 2(g) + 2 NaOH (aq) Incorrect. In this equation, we can see that the H 2 O has dissociated into H and OH - , and the OH - has combined with Na to form NaOH. H 2 O is not acting as an acid in this case since it is not acting as an H + producer, an H + donor, nor an electron pair acceptor. Option B. NO 2 - (aq) + H 2 O(l) ⇌ HNO 2(aq) + OH - (aq) Correct. In this equation, we can see that the H 2 O has donated an H + ion to NO 2 - , resulting in the production of HNO 2 . Therefore, H 2 O is acting as an acid in this reaction. Option C. 2 H 2(g) + O2 (g) ⇌ 2 H 2 O (l) Incorrect. In this equation, we can see that the H 2 has combined with O 2 to form H 2 O. H 2 O is not acting as an acid in this case since it is not acting as an H+ producer, an H + donor, nor an electron pair acceptor. Option D. CH 3 COOH (aq) + H 2 O (l) ⇌ H 3 O+ (aq) + CH 3 COO - (aq) Incorrect. In this equation, we can see that the H 2 O has accepted an H + ion from CH 3 COOH, resulting in the production of H 3 O + . Therefore, H 2 O is acting as a base in this reaction. Option E. H 2 O (l) + H 3 PO 4(aq) ⇌ H 3 O+ (aq) + H 2 PO 4 - (aq) Incorrect. In this equation, we can see that the H 2 O has accepted an H + ion from H 3 PO 4 , resulting in the production of H 3 O + . Therefore, H 2 O is acting as a base in this reaction. Therefore, the answer is B .

question.text: Each of the following statements about acids and bases are correct EXCEPT one. Which one is the EXCEPTION?

options.label: A.
options.text: A Bronsted-Lowry acid donates a proton to another species

options.label: B.
options.text: An Arrhenius acid produces H+ ions in solution

options.label: C.
options.text: A Lewis base donates an electron pair to another species

options.label: D.
options.text: An Arrhenius base produces OH- ions in solution

options.label: E.
options.text: A Lewis acid accepts a proton from another species

correct_answer_text: A Lewis acid accepts a proton from another species

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving types of acids and bases , we will need to review the various definitions of acids and bases. Arrhenius Definition of Acids and Bases Bronsted-Lowry Definition of Acids and Bases Lewis Definition of Acids and Bases In this case, we can see that the statement “A Lewis acid accepts a proton from another species” (Option E) is incorrect, because a Lewis acid accepts a pair of electrons from another species. Therefore, the answer is E .
